nscDxGlChanEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlChanEntKeyId
nscDxGlChanEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlChanEntActivityState.name: nscDxGlChanEntActivityState
nscDxGlChanEntActivityState.description: This is the actual state of the HCI (which depends on the IP state and online/offline state of the HCI).

nscDxGlChanEntResetState.name: nscDxGlChanEntResetState
nscDxGlChanEntResetState.description: This identifies the pending channel reset to process.

nscDxGlChanEntIplState.name: nscDxGlChanEntIplState
nscDxGlChanEntIplState.description: This is the state prior to the first command chain being completed. It is used for IPL.

nscDxGlChanEntIpState.name: nscDxGlChanEntIpState
nscDxGlChanEntIpState.description: This indicates whether the interface has been set online by the coprocessor. It indicates whether a Start I/F has been sent by the coprocessor.

nscDxGlChanEntOnlineOfflineState.name: nscDxGlChanEntOnlineOfflineState
nscDxGlChanEntOnlineOfflineState.description: This indicates the state of the switch on the back of the HCI.

nscDxGlChanEntPolling.name: nscDxGlChanEntPolling
nscDxGlChanEntPolling.description: For a bus-tag-hci type channel this indicates whether the HCI will request polling on the RCIs that it connects to. For a bus-tag-rci type channel this indicates whether the RCI will allow polling on its channel interface.

nscDxGlChanEntActiveSubchannel.name: nscDxGlChanEntActiveSubchannel
nscDxGlChanEntActiveSubchannel.description: The HCI device address of the active device.

nscDxGlChanEntDcOverruns.name: nscDxGlChanEntDcOverruns
nscDxGlChanEntDcOverruns.description: Number of channel overruns in DC interlock mode.

nscDxGlChanEntDsOverruns.name: nscDxGlChanEntDsOverruns
nscDxGlChanEntDsOverruns.description: Number of channel overruns in data streaming mode.

nscDxGlChanEntResetsDuringDma.name: nscDxGlChanEntResetsDuringDma
nscDxGlChanEntResetsDuringDma.description: Number of times the DMA operation has been terminated by channel resets (selective reset, interface reconnect, system reset).

nscDxGlChanEntCmdParityErrors.name: nscDxGlChanEntCmdParityErrors
nscDxGlChanEntCmdParityErrors.description: Number of channel command parity errors (a Bus parity error with Command Out active).

nscDxGlChanEntStatusAcceptDiscIns.name: nscDxGlChanEntStatusAcceptDiscIns
nscDxGlChanEntStatusAcceptDiscIns.description: Number of status accept disconnect in errors.

nscDxGlChanEntStatusWaitDiscIns.name: nscDxGlChanEntStatusWaitDiscIns
nscDxGlChanEntStatusWaitDiscIns.description: Number of status wait disconnect in errors.

nscDxGlChanEntNumCus.name: nscDxGlChanEntNumCus
nscDxGlChanEntNumCus.description: Number of control units per interface.

nscDxGlChanEntChannelStatus.name: nscDxGlChanEntChannelStatus
nscDxGlChanEntChannelStatus.description: The status of the channel interface.

nscDxGlProfControlUnitEntry.name: nscDxGlProfControlUnitEntry
nscDxGlProfControlUnitEntry.description: Control Unit entry. This entry defines controller and device operating characteristics. Some of the characteristics are: the address ranges the HCI responds to, the type of devices that are supported, and the operational condition of the HCI interface device.

nscDxGlProfCuEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntKeyId
nscDxGlProfCuEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlProfCuEntCuNum.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntCuNum
nscDxGlProfCuEntCuNum.description: The profile number of the controller. The HCI supports up to 16 controller definitions (a unique set of operating and address characteristics for a type of device). The controller establishes the operation conditions of a device.

nscDxGlProfCuEntNumDevices.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntNumDevices
nscDxGlProfCuEntNumDevices.description: Number of devices on this control unit.

nscDxGlProfCuEntOnlineOfflineState.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntOnlineOfflineState
nscDxGlProfCuEntOnlineOfflineState.description: The profiled state of the device(s).

nscDxGlProfCuEntDeviceType.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntDeviceType
nscDxGlProfCuEntDeviceType.description: The type of device associated with the controller function. The controller uses a specific CCW table tailored for the unique operating characteristics of that particular device. It allows the controller to reference a table identifying the unique operating characteristics of that particular device type.

nscDxGlProfCuEntHostStartingDevAddr.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntHostStartingDevAddr
nscDxGlProfCuEntHostStartingDevAddr.description: The first HCI device address in the range of addresses associated with the specified controller definition.

nscDxGlProfCuEntHostEndingDevAddr.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntHostEndingDevAddr
nscDxGlProfCuEntHostEndingDevAddr.description: The last HCI device address in the range of addresses associated with the specified controller definition. NOTE: This is used in conjunction with the nscDxGlProfCuEntHostStartingDevAddr variable. The total number of device addresses in range is bounded by the nscDxGlProfCuEntHostStartingDevAddr and nscDxGlProfCuEntHostEndingDevAddr values for the specified controller definition.

nscDxGlProfCuEntHostChannelSpeed.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntHostChannelSpeed
nscDxGlProfCuEntHostChannelSpeed.description: The HCI channel speed to the host. This defines to the HCI the data transfer protocol and data transfer rate used for the specified controller definition.

nscDxGlProfCuEntHostBufferRequirements.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntHostBufferRequirements
nscDxGlProfCuEntHostBufferRequirements.description: The number of data buffers the HCI will allocate for a write I/O command.

nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtIpAddr.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtIpAddr
nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtIpAddr.description: The IP address of the remote interface, either an RCI where devices are attached, or an HCI for CTC.

nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtStartingDevAddr.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtStartingDevAddr
nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtStartingDevAddr.description: The first remote device address in the range of addresses associated with the specified controller definition. This can be used only to map addresses recognized by the host to different addresses at the device. If address mapping is not used, nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtStartingDevAddr should be the same as nscDxGlProfCuEntHostStartingDevAddr.

nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtBufferHold.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtBufferHold
nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtBufferHold.description: This indicates whether an RCI should wait for all the data associated with a CCW to be received before starting the device. Each device-type CCW table assigns this attribute to the appropriate CCW's for that device. It is generally enabled for overrunable devices.

nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtChannelSpeed.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtChannelSpeed
nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtChannelSpeed.description: The remote channel speed to the device. This defines to the remote interface what data transfer protocol and data transfer rate should be used for the specified devices.

nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtBufferRequirements.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtBufferRequirements
nscDxGlProfCuEntRmtBufferRequirements.description: The number of data buffers an RCI will allocate for read I/O commands.

nscDxGlProfCuEntUnsolStatusOption.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntUnsolStatusOption
nscDxGlProfCuEntUnsolStatusOption.description: This variable profiles the HCI to handle unsolicited status. When unsolicited status is received by the HCI from an RCI, the status is queued for presentation to the channel, except if the device is busy. If the device is busy, the status is handled in one of the following ways, depending upon which option has been defined. discard - profiles the HCI to discard the unsolicited status q-non-uc - profiles the HCI to always queue the unsolicited status q-uc - profiles the HCI to queue the unsolicited status only if it contains Unit Check status

nscDxGlProfCuEntDevDriverOptions.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntDevDriverOptions
nscDxGlProfCuEntDevDriverOptions.description: The device driver options. See the 7220/7256 Host & Remote Channel Interfaces (HCI & RCI) with Greenline-IP software (GLH-IP/GLD-IP) reference manual (460793). The value depends on the device driver in use.

nscDxGlProfCuEntHostBufferHold.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntHostBufferHold
nscDxGlProfCuEntHostBufferHold.description: This indicates whether the HCI should wait for all of the data associated with a CCW to be received before reconnecting to the channel.

nscDxGlProfCuEntWindowSize.name: nscDxGlProfCuEntWindowSize
nscDxGlProfCuEntWindowSize.description: This variable specifies the number of IP packets that transport will sent before it waits for an acknowledgement to come back. The following value are allowed. 1 = 8 packets. 2 = 16 packets. 3 = 32 packets. 4 = 64 packets. 5 = 128 packets. 6 = 256 packets. 7 = 512 packets.

nscDxGlProfDeviceEntry.name: nscDxGlProfDeviceEntry
nscDxGlProfDeviceEntry.description: Device entry. States whether device is profiled online or offline.

nscDxGlProfDevEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlProfDevEntKeyId
nscDxGlProfDevEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlDevStatusEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlDevStatusEntKeyId
nscDxGlDevStatusEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlDevStatusEntOnOffState.name: nscDxGlDevStatusEntOnOffState
nscDxGlDevStatusEntOnOffState.description: Specifies if the device is online, offline, or marked offline.

nscDxGlDevStatusEntReservedState.name: nscDxGlDevStatusEntReservedState
nscDxGlDevStatusEntReservedState.description: Specifies if the device is reserved by this HCI.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntKeyId
nscDxGlSesStatsEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInControlReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInControlReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInControlReqs.description: The number of control request packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInControlResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInControlResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInControlResps.description: The number of control response packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInDevAvailResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInDevAvailResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInDevAvailResps.description: The number of device available response packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInDevStatResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInDevStatResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInDevStatResps.description: The number of device status response packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInitReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInitReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInitReqs.description: The number of init request packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInitResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInitResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInitResps.description: The number of init response packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInReserveReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInReserveReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInReserveReqs.description: The number of reserve request packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInReserveResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInReserveResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInReserveResps.description: The number of reserve response packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInSenseReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInSenseReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInSenseReqs.description: The number of sense request packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInSenseResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInSenseResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInSenseResps.description: The number of sense response packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInUnreserveReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInUnreserveReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInUnreserveReqs.description: The number of unreserve request packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInvalids.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInvalids
nscDxGlSesStatsEntInInvalids.description: The number of invalid packets received by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutControlReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutControlReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutControlReqs.description: The number of control request packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutControlResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutControlResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutControlResps.description: The number of control response packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutDevAvailResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutDevAvailResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutDevAvailResps.description: The number of device available response packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutDevStatResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutDevStatResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutDevStatResps.description: The number of device status response packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInitReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInitReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInitReqs.description: The number of init request packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInitResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInitResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInitResps.description: The number of init response packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutReserveReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutReserveReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutReserveReqs.description: The number of reserve request packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutReserveResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutReserveResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutReserveResps.description: The number of reserve response packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutSenseReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutSenseReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutSenseReqs.description: The number of sense request packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutSenseResps.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutSenseResps
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutSenseResps.description: The number of sense response packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutUnreserveReqs.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutUnreserveReqs
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutUnreserveReqs.description: The number of unreserve request packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInvalids.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInvalids
nscDxGlSesStatsEntOutInvalids.description: The number of invalid packets sent by session.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntHciMaxSessions.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntHciMaxSessions
nscDxGlSesStatsEntHciMaxSessions.description: Maximum number of HCIs that can be connected to the RCI.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntRciMaxSessions.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntRciMaxSessions
nscDxGlSesStatsEntRciMaxSessions.description: Maximum number of remote interfaces that can be connected to the HCI.

nscDxGlSesStatsEntRciPollStatus.name: nscDxGlSesStatsEntRciPollStatus
nscDxGlSesStatsEntRciPollStatus.description: This indicates whether automatic device polling is active.

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntKeyId
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntIpAddress.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntIpAddress
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntIpAddress.description: The IP address of the remote RCI/HCI.

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntStatus.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntStatus
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntStatus.description: Session status. In normal operations it will be open

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntSendState.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntSendState
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntSendState.description: The current state of the outbound data stream.

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntRecvState.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntRecvState
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntRecvState.description: The current state of the inbound data stream.

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntAddr.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntAddr
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntAddr.description: The local address of the device currently receiving data from the connected HCI.

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntFlags.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntFlags
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntFlags.description: Session flag information. This is represented by an array of flags, with each flag represented by one hex digit which will have the value of one (on) or zero (off). The value may have multiple flags set at the same time. The following flags are currently in use. 10000000 - Polling has been requested by this HCI 1000000 - Reset has been sent 100000 - Session is congested

nscDxGlSesHciConnEntReconn.name: nscDxGlSesHciConnEntReconn
nscDxGlSesHciConnEntReconn.description: The amount of time in seconds between reconnects. It is only valid if status is closed.

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntKeyId
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntIpAddress.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntIpAddress
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntIpAddress.description: The IP address of the remote HCI.

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntStatus.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntStatus
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntStatus.description: Session status. In normal operations it will be open

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntSendState.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntSendState
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntSendState.description: The current state of the outbound data stream.

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntRecvState.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntRecvState
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntRecvState.description: The current state of the inbound data stream.

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntAddr.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntAddr
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntAddr.description: The local address of the device currently receiving data from this RCI.

nscDxGlSesRciConnEntFlags.name: nscDxGlSesRciConnEntFlags
nscDxGlSesRciConnEntFlags.description: Session flag information. This is represented by an array of flags, with each flag represented by one hex digit which will have the value of one (on) or zero (off). The value may have multiple flags set at the same time. The following flags are currently in use. 10000000 - Polling has been requested by remote HCI 1000000 - Reset has been sent 100000 - Session is congested

nscDxGlSesDevEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlSesDevEntKeyId
nscDxGlSesDevEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlSesDevEntReserve.name: nscDxGlSesDevEntReserve
nscDxGlSesDevEntReserve.description: The session number of the HCI that has reserved the device. This value will -1 if the device is not currently reserved.

nscDxGlSesDevEntPrimed.name: nscDxGlSesDevEntPrimed
nscDxGlSesDevEntPrimed.description: Bit map with each bit representing an HCI that is waiting for the device to become unreserved. The right most bit corresponds to HCI 0.

nscDxGlSesDevEntStat.name: nscDxGlSesDevEntStat
nscDxGlSesDevEntStat.description: The status of the device, as given in the following: 0x80 - device is offline 0x40 - device in online but does not respond 0-7 - number of sense bytes

nscDxGlXportStatsEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntKeyId
nscDxGlXportStatsEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInAcks.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInAcks
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInAcks.description: The number of ack packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInConnects.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInConnects
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInConnects.description: The number of connect packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataDups.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataDups
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataDups.description: The number of data dup packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInOrders.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInOrders
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInOrders.description: The number of data in order packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInvalids.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInvalids
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInvalids.description: The number of data invalid packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInWindows.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInWindows
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDataInWindows.description: The number of data in window packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDiscs.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDiscs
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInDiscs.description: The number of disconnect packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInNacks.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInNacks
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInNacks.description: The number of nack packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInProbes.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInProbes
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInProbes.description: The number of probe packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInProbeResps.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInProbeResps
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInProbeResps.description: The number of probe response packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadPckts.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadPckts
nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadPckts.description: The number of bad packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadXcbs.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadXcbs
nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadXcbs.description: The number of bad xcb packets received by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutAcks.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutAcks
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutAcks.description: The number of ack packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutConnects.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutConnects
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutConnects.description: The number of connect packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutDatas.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutDatas
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutDatas.description: The number of data packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutDiscs.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutDiscs
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutDiscs.description: The number of disconnect packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutNacks.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutNacks
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutNacks.description: The number of nack packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutProbes.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutProbes
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutProbes.description: The number of probe packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutProbeResps.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutProbeResps
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutProbeResps.description: The number of probe response packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntReconns.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntReconns
nscDxGlXportStatsEntReconns.description: The number of reconnect packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntRetransmits.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntRetransmits
nscDxGlXportStatsEntRetransmits.description: The number of retransmit packets sent by transport.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadChecksums.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadChecksums
nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadChecksums.description: The number of bad checksum errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadVersions.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadVersions
nscDxGlXportStatsEntBadVersions.description: The number of bad version errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntConnTimeouts.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntConnTimeouts
nscDxGlXportStatsEntConnTimeouts.description: The number of connect timeout errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntInitXcbExists.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntInitXcbExists
nscDxGlXportStatsEntInitXcbExists.description: The number of xcb exists errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoHdrSpaces.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoHdrSpaces
nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoHdrSpaces.description: The number of no header space errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoMemorys.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoMemorys
nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoMemorys.description: The number of no memory errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoPes.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoPes
nscDxGlXportStatsEntNoPes.description: The number of no pe errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutOfSeqDatas.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutOfSeqDatas
nscDxGlXportStatsEntOutOfSeqDatas.description: The number of out of sequence data errors.

nscDxGlXportStatsEntShortPackets.name: nscDxGlXportStatsEntShortPackets
nscDxGlXportStatsEntShortPackets.description: The number of short packets errors.

nscDxGlXportConnEntKeyId.name: nscDxGlXportConnEntKeyId
nscDxGlXportConnEntKeyId.description: Processor Key ID (KID). This is a unique value for each interface.

nscDxGlXportConnEntXopt.name: nscDxGlXportConnEntXopt
nscDxGlXportConnEntXopt.description: Xport option information. This is represented by an array of flags, with each flag represented by one hex digit which will have the value of one (on) or zero (off). The value may have multiple flags set at the same time. The following flags are currently in use. 10000000 - Return data 1000000 - Fast search

nscDxGlXportConnEntWindowSize.name: nscDxGlXportConnEntWindowSize
nscDxGlXportConnEntWindowSize.description: Window size specified as a packet count, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, or 256

nscDxGlXportConnEntXcbFlags.name: nscDxGlXportConnEntXcbFlags
nscDxGlXportConnEntXcbFlags.description: Xport flag information. This is represented by an array of flags, with each flag represented by one hex digit which will have the value of one (on) or zero (off). The value may have multiple flags set at the same time. The following flags are currently in use. 10000000 - Owed ack 1000000 - Owe ack 100000 - Owed probe 10000 - Congested
